intro: Licaria maguireana, commonly known as the Guatemalan licaria, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Licaria maguireana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
